org.mitre.provenance.dag

Class DAGPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.dag.DAGPath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class DAGPath
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    A DAGPath is a specific thread running through an existing LineageDAG. Because LineageDAG encapsulates all of the complexity of edge voting and surrogates, DAGPaths can't exist independent of a particular DAG.
    Author:
    DMALLEN

      • DAGPath

        public DAGPath(LineageDAG dag,
               PLUSObject from,

      • DAGPath

        public DAGPath(LineageDAG dag,
               PLUSObject from,
               PLUSObject to)
        throws PLUSException
        Find a new DAGPath from one point to another within a particular dag. This will use depth-first search to locate the path for you. No guarantee that this is the shortest or best path in the DAG.
        Parameters:
        dag - the source DAG to use for finding the path.
        from - the starting point.
        to - the ending point
        Throws:
        PLUSException - if the path does not exist in the DAG

      • addStep

        public void addStep(PathStep step)
        Add a path step to the path. This method checks for coherence - the step must be contiguous with the last step, otherwise an exception will result.
        Parameters:
        step - a new step to add to the chain.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()

      • getLength

        public int getLength()

        Does deep comparison of a path to make sure that one path is equal to another.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String oid)

      • isDirected

        public boolean isDirected()
        Determine whether the DAGPath is directed. Directed paths will have a sequence of steps that respect edge ordering, and the source will be strictly before the target in the graph.
        Returns:
        true if the path is directed, false otherwise.

      • pathExists

        public static boolean pathExists(LineageDAG dag,
                                 PLUSObject from,
                                 PLUSObject to)
        Determine whether or not a path exists between two nodes in a LineageDAG
        Parameters:
        dag - the dag to check
        from - the starting node
        to - the ending node
        Returns:
        true if a path exists from the starting node to the ending node under the specified DAG. False otherwise.
